qas.question: What enables the Scottish Parliament to scrutinize the government?
Who can question statements the First Minister or members of the cabinet make?

answers.text: leaders of the opposition parties and other MSPs

qas.question: What does the First Minister deliver at the beginning of each parliamentary year?

answers.text: legislative programme for the forthcoming year
a statement to the chamber setting out the Government's legislative programme for the forthcoming year

qas.question: What do the leaders of the opposition parties and other MSPs question the First Minister about?

answers.text: issues related to the substance of the statement
issues related to the substance of the statement

qas.question: How does the Scottish Parliament scrutinize the people?
The Second Minister can deliver what?
Before the statement is delivered, who is questioned?
Whom can the Second Minister deliver statements to?
